snippet: The battle to succeed Senator Harry Reid of Nevada, who is retiring, is one of a handful of contests that could determine control of Congress....
abstract: Close United States Senate race in Nevada, between Republican Rep Joe Heck and Democrat Catherine Cortez Masto for seat held by retiring Sen Harry Reid, will likely be decided by which side has better ground game; so-called super PACs are particularly important for get-out-the-vote operations, especially on Republican side, as many voters struggle to reconcile their views with those of presidential nominee Donald Trump.
lead_paragraph: The battle to succeed Senator Harry Reid of Nevada, who is retiring, is one of a handful of contests that could determine control of Congress.

headline.main: A Key Senate Race Shifts to a Ground Game: Knocking on Doors
headline.print_headline: Key Nevada Senate Race Shifts to Ground Game: Knocking on Doors
